content: मंत्रः [मंत्र्-अच्] {@--1@} A Vedic hymn or sacred prayer (addressed to any deity), a sacred text; (it is of three kinds:--it is called ऋच् if metrical and intended to be loudly recited; यजुस् if in prose and muttered in a low tone; and सामन् if, being metrical, it is intended for chanting). {@--2@} The portion of the Veda including the Saṃhitā and distinguished from the {%Brāhmaṇa%} <ab>q. v.</ab> {@--3@} A charm, spell, an incantation; सोहमस्मि मंत्रसिद्धः <ls>Dk. 54</ls>; नहि जीवंति जनाः मनागमंत्राः <ls>Bv. 1. 111</ls>; अचिंत्यो हि मणिमंत्रौषधीनां प्रभावः <ls>Ratn. 2</ls>; <ls>R. 2. 32</ls>, <ls n="R.">5. 57.</ls> {@--4@} A formula (of prayer) sacred to any deity; as ओं नमः शिवाय &c. {@--5@} Consuitation, deliberation, counsel, advice, resolution plan; तस्य संवृतमंत्रस्य <ls>R. 1. 20</ls>; मंत्रः प्रतिदिनं तस्य बभूव सह मंत्रिमिः <ls n="R.">17. 50</ls>; <ls>Pt. 2. 182</ls>; <ls>Ms. 7. 58.</ls> {@--6@} Secret plan or consultation, a secret. {@--7@} Policy, statesmanship.
